metadata.title: CVE-2017-14994 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.description:
ReadDCMImage in coders/dcm.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via acrafted DICOM image, related to the ability of DCM_ReadNonNativeImages toyield an image list with zero frames.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14994` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-13
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-13
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-13
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-13
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-13').
